tool_description:
PagePixels provides free screenshots, scheduled screenshots, multi-step screenshots (complete forms, login to websites, etc) and built-in deliveries to services such as Slack, Dropbox, and Webhooks.  We make it easy to keep your dashboards, status pages, and employees up-to-date with the latest information from around the web.

PagePixels also empowers your team to keep track of changes.  Each configuration can be configured with an unlimited number of change notifications, allowing you to ke...
name: PagePixels Screenshots
title: PagePixels Screenshots

api_list.name: /snap
api_list.description: This endpoint takes a screenshot immediately. By default it returns the requested image. If the json argument is set to true, it will return a json object containing the direct link and the thumbnail link to the image.

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description:
The URL you would like to capture. For example:

https://pagepixels.com

optional_parameters.name: json
optional_parameters.description: The snap endpoint returns the image directly by default. When json is set to true, it will return the image's metadata including both the direct and thumbnail links

optional_parameters.name: accuracy
optional_parameters.description:
Provide location information to the browser. You can learn more about the latitude, longitude, and accuracy configuration settings here:

Learn More

optional_parameters.name: js_inject
optional_parameters.description: Inject any Javascript you need on the page.

optional_parameters.name: latitude
optional_parameters.description:
Provide location information to the browser. You can learn more about the latitude, longitude, and accuracy configuration settings here:

Learn More

optional_parameters.name: longitude
optional_parameters.description:
Provide location information to the browser. You can learn more about the latitude, longitude, and accuracy configuration settings here:

Learn More

optional_parameters.name: accept_language
optional_parameters.description:
Instruct the browser to ask the website to display a specific language. This is great for websites that support multiple languages. You can learn more about this setting here:

Learn More

optional_parameters.name: css_inject
optional_parameters.description: Inject any CSS declarations you need into the page.

optional_parameters.name: user_agent
optional_parameters.description:
Give the browser additional information about the type of device that is connecting to the website. You can learn more about the User Agent setting here:

Learn More

optional_parameters.name: quality
optional_parameters.description: Quality defines the JPEG compression, where 1 produces the lowest quality image and 100 creates the highest quality image. The higher the quality, the larger the image will be. This setting is ignored if you are producing a PNG image.

optional_parameters.name: scale_factor
optional_parameters.description: Scale factor 2 produces a Retina display scaled image.

optional_parameters.name: wait_for
optional_parameters.description:
Provide a CSS selector that should appear on the page before the screenshot is captured. For example:

#id-to-wait-for

optional_parameters.name: page_height
optional_parameters.description: This is the height of the browser when the screenshot is taken.

optional_parameters.name: selectors
optional_parameters.description:
By default, a screenshot of the entire window is taken. But, you can provide a CSS selector to screenshot only a specific part of the page. You can learn more about CSS selectors here:

Learn More

optional_parameters.name: placeholder_url
optional_parameters.description: The image at the provided URL will be displayed until the first screenshot is captured. The provided URL should return an image.

optional_parameters.name: page_width
optional_parameters.description: This is the width of the browser when the screenshot is taken.

optional_parameters.name: wait
optional_parameters.description: How many milliseconds after the webpage has loaded should we wait to capture the screenshot? Maximum wait time is 20 seconds.

optional_parameters.name: hover_on_selected
optional_parameters.description: If you provided a CSS selector above, you can check this option to have us hover over the object before taking the screenshot. This gives you the ability to display the :hover styles for the associated element if needed.

optional_parameters.name: fullpage
optional_parameters.description: By default, screenshots capture only the image within the viewport. With Full Page selected, the entire page is scrolled and captured.

api_list.name: /jobs/{job_id}
api_list.description: The job status endpoint checks if the screenshot associated the job_id returned by the create and capture endpoints is complete.

api_list.name: /screenshots
api_list.description: This endpoint provides an array of all screenshots captured for the entire account.

optional_parameters.name: before_date
optional_parameters.description: Return only records created before this date. Date should be a UNIX Timestamp with or without milliseconds.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: The page you would like to retrieve.

optional_parameters.name: after_date
optional_parameters.description: Return only records created after this date. Date should be a UNIX Timestamp with or without milliseconds.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Limit the total number of records returned by the request.

optional_parameters.name: order
optional_parameters.description: Can be either ASC or DESC. Records returned in DESC (descending) order will return the most recent records first to the oldest records. Records returned in ASC (ascending) order will return the oldest records first to the newest records

api_list.name: /change_notifications
api_list.description: This endpoint provides an array of all Change Notifications for all screenshot configurations.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Limit the total number of records returned by the request.

optional_parameters.name: before_date
optional_parameters.description: Return only records created before this date. Date should be a UNIX Timestamp with or without milliseconds.

optional_parameters.name: order
optional_parameters.description: Can be either ASC or DESC. Records returned in DESC (descending) order will return the most recent records first to the oldest records. Records returned in ASC (ascending) order will return the oldest records first to the newest records

optional_parameters.name: after_date
optional_parameters.description: Return only records created after this date. Date should be a UNIX Timestamp with or without milliseconds.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: The page you would like to retrieve.

api_list.name: /screenshot_configs/{id}/screenshots
api_list.description: This endpoint provides an array of all screenshots previously captured by the screenshot configuration.

optional_parameters.name: order
optional_parameters.description: Can be either ASC or DESC. Records returned in DESC (descending) order will return the most recent records first to the oldest records. Records returned in ASC (ascending) order will return the oldest records first to the newest records

optional_parameters.name: after_date
optional_parameters.description: Return only records created after this date. Date should be a UNIX Timestamp with or without milliseconds.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: The page you would like to retrieve.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Limit the total number of records returned by the request.

optional_parameters.name: before_date
optional_parameters.description: Return only records created before this date. Date should be a UNIX Timestamp with or without milliseconds.

api_list.name: /screenshot_configs/{id}
api_list.description: This endpoint returns the configuration associated with any screenshot configuration created with the create endpoint.

api_list.name: /screenshot_configs
api_list.description: This endpoint provides an array of all Screenshot Configurations in your account.

api_list.name: /screenshot_configs/{id}/change_notifications
api_list.description: This endpoint provides an array of all Change Notifications for a specific screenshot configuration.
